title: Seeking Display-size Quotation Mark
content:
I'm looking for a quotation mark that works as a display-size graphic and pairs well with Ed Roman and Ed Gothic:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/getimage%5B1%5D_5888.php_id=830)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/getimage%5B1%5D_3518.php_id=829)

I've made Ed Roman warmer and heavier with an outline stroke (not shown). And don't worry about the quotation marks being "fun," I can just shift one glyph higher than the other to make it fit in.

Unfortunately, the quotes on these fonts don't quite work for me, nor does anything I currently have installed. The best I could come up with, oddly, was Stencil, the "it came with the computer" font. Here's Ed Gothic, Ed Roman and Stencil:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/quotes_4351.png)

Gothic's to stubby, Roman's too wiry, and Stencil has about the right proportion, but the tail (finial? hangy-down? hangy-up?) should probably come to a point, or near-point. Here they are, more "fun":

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/funquotes_5194.png)

Any suggestions?
author: pdxuser

comments.content:
What about [Burbank](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&category=&id=565#565), which is essentially an expanded take on the Ed Gothic style?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_rend_4486.png)

It's more or less the same stubby character as Ed Gothic. I should stress that the quotation mark will be a standalone graphic. The actual quotation text will be set in a web font, likely Georgia. The quotation mark should really just look like what an average user would expect it to look like: a big ball with a curl coming out of it, tapering to a point ... and then a twin next to it.

Ahh, then you might want to head to display Didone territory.

[Annlie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/annlie_extra_bold/?sample_text=%E2%80%9C%E2%80%9D&sample_size=144)  
 [Carousel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/carousel_regular/?sample_text=%E2%80%9C%E2%80%9D&sample_size=144)  
 [Didona](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/paratype/didona_book_ot/?sample_text=%E2%80%9C%E2%80%9D&sample_size=144)  
 [Didoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/didoni_normal_ot_std_urw/?sample_text=%E2%80%9C%E2%80%9D&sample_size=144)  
 [Spumoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002147/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/spumoni_regular/?sample_text=%E2%80%9C%E2%80%9D&sample_size=288)
Thanks, that's what I'm looking for!
